revised_title: Influence of Alum Solutions on Absorption Spectra and Partial Tones of Pianoforte Strings
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the upper partial tones of a pianoforte string struck at one-eighth of its length. They discovered the existence of the 5th, 6th, 7th, 8th, 9th, 10th, and 11th partials in the sound produced. The study also explored the effects of alum solutions on absorption spectra and their influence on the tones of the pianoforte string.
